publicwhip.spmotion: * S2M-2945 Campbell Martin:Traffic and Travel Information in South-West Scotland—That the Parliament congratulates West FM, West Sound and South West Sound FM for initiating a specific traffic and travel information service for motorists driving on urban and rural routes in Ayrshire and Dumfries and Galloway; recognises that two travel and traffic executives have been employed by the radio stations to provide “real time” travel information to motorists in south-west Scotland, and calls on the Scottish Executive and its trunk road operator, Amey Highways, to erect along trunk roads in Ayrshire and Dumfries and Galloway signposts that inform drivers of the radio frequency on which they can receive these “real time” traffic and travel updates.

S2M-2945 Campbell Martin: Traffic and Travel Information in South-West Scotland—That the Parliament congratulates West FM, West Sound and South West Sound FM for initiating a specific traffic and travel information service for motorists driving on urban and rural routes in Ayrshire and Dumfries and Galloway; recognises that two travel and traffic executives have been employed by the radio stations to provide “real time” travel information to motorists in south-west Scotland, and calls on the Scottish Executive and its trunk road operator, Amey Highways, to erect along trunk roads in Ayrshire and Dumfries and Galloway signposts that inform drivers of the radio frequency on which they can receive these “real time” traffic and travel updates. Supported by: Rosie Kane*, Christine Grahame*, Rob Gibson*, Murray Tosh*
S2M-2945 Traffic and Travel Information in South-West Scotland (lodged on 9 June 2005) Phil Gallie*, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-2945 Traffic and Travel Information in South-West Scotland (lodged on 9 June 2005) Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-2945 Traffic and Travel Information in South-West Scotland (lodged on 9 June 2005) Dr Jean Turner*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-2945 Traffic and Travel Information in South-West Scotland (lodged on 9 June 2005) John Swinburne*
S2M-2945 Traffic and Travel Information in South-West Scotland (lodged on 9 June 2005) John Scott*
